statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ -6 \\ 9 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -30 \\ 21 \\ -26 \\ -22 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ -6 \\ 9 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -30 \\ 21 \\ -26 \\ -22 \end{array}\right].
